result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan B Okonek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: -To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.  Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

-To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.  Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ryan B Okonek

records.addlTxt:
1:07 PM Defendant Ryan B Okonek in court.  Attorney William Henry Gergen in court for Ryan B Okonek.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 with probation and conditions and count 2 will be dismissed and read-in. DA concurs. Atty Gergen concurs. Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant. Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST. Court finds the plea is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea. Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as charged and orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. Sentencing statement by DA. Sentencing statement by Atty Gergen. Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 12 months.

CONDITIONS:

-$200 fine plus costs. To be paid to the Clerk of Courts office.  Monies are to be paid during the term of probation.  Failure to pay may result in the suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency. 
-AODA and any follow-up.  
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

Court adjourned at 1:16 PM

ADDRESS INFO for Ryan B Okonek
Current: 213 2nd Street, Baraboo, WI 53913 United States  (Effective: 04-14-2022)
Prior: 224 Henry St, Beaver Dam, WI 53916
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 24, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on April 19, 2022 at 08:00 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 001491,
Payable Number: 67576,
Receipt Number: 22R 000401,
Amount: $20.00

9:42 AM Defendant Ryan B Okonek appeared in court, Attorney Bradford Paul Bollmann appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant has not received a copy of the criminal complaint. Defendant now confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court finds probable cause. Court instructs the defendant of his/her right to an attorney. Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY. Defendant requests to talk with the DA to see if an agreement can be reached. Court instructs defendant of his/her right to counsel. Court notes bond has been set. Court will set for Status of Counsel on February 1, 2022 at 11:00 AM.

Court adjourned at 9:46 AM
Second appearance scheduled for February 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Second appearance on February 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance.
Initial appearance on January 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance.

1:37 PM Defendant Ryan B Okonek appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Bradford Paul Bollmann appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Michael Kapelis is not representing the defendant for this hearing. Court questions defendant regarding address and phone number. Statement by defendant. ADA makes bond recommendation. Court orders bond at $2,500.00 signature bond and conditions of: Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription. You may be randomly tested for compliance. Court sets for Initial Appearance on January 18, 2022 at 9:30 AM.

Court adjourned at 1:44 PM
